headline: Worst company I have worked at
pros: I have nothing positive to say at all
cons:
Run by an egotist who rules by fear. No business logic, no rational behaviour, everyone looks after their own agenda - mainly surviving the owners mood swings. 
Racist culture - run by Indian expats who treat local staff with utter contempt. 
Really poor working environment, poor IT, poor processes, all decision making needs to be supported by hundreds of paper memos and takes forever as everyone is scared of making a decision and wants to cover their back.
Pay is intermittent and can be changed arbitrarily.

headline: Pseudo Management Structure
pros: Attracts a rich pool of talents. Could pay any price to have the best brains added to the pool.
cons:
Zero Budget for staff training, grossly relying on on-the-job to coach management Trainee. Zero growth plan, purely opportunistic and political.
Toxic communication and behavioural system amongst owner, Senior management, all the way down to the janitors. 
Poor compensation.
A bulk of daily technical operational costs are grossly run on staff personal incomes with refund come at will, somes spanning over a year.
Pay rise is neither patterned or guaranteed. Non in my last 4 years + with the organization.

headline: Not a good place to work. Waste of career.
pros: None. Except for the fact that grossly incompetent people can easily get a job there if they know someone and the interview process is such a joke.
cons: It's poorly run. Horrible one man business. Barely any promotions. No training. People transferred out of the country are given little to no benefits. No gratuity after working for over 10 years there. Same salary for 9 years. Politics and bottom power in everything. Poorly maintained buildings and facilities.

headline: Globacom
pros: Nice place to work. A team of lovely colleagues and professionals
cons: Rigid and not well structured for personal and career developments

headline: Retail Expansion and Sales Manager
pros:
Globacom grooms you to grow your Essential Selling Skills  by training you, making you to exhibit and demonstrate your talents . They have trained in the following areas :
•	Marketing Management                    Globacom   Communication, Kano                2014
•	Key Account Management               Globacom Communication, Abuja                 2014
•	Warehouse Management   Skills      Globacom  Communication 
I am grateful to Globacom for this development plans
cons: Globacom should learn to promote skills and talents . people who have spent more years and are very good at what they do should be encouraged through promotion and recognition .

headline: Horrible experience at Globacom
pros: I can't really think of any pros working with Globacom, I believe the top management staff might have story to tell with respect to any positive experience in Globacom but definitely not the lower management staff
cons: Working with Globacom is really a horrible experience from every angle you may think of it. No medical, no tools to work with, no training ,no annual salary review as you may have in most organisation, it's possible to be on a salary for more than ten years without pay rise , no career progression,you can be on the same job role for more than seven years without promotion, poor working environment, godfatherism at every department. If you are unfortunate to be transferred to other African country, you will be working illegally as you are expected to work without work permits, without accommodation, work for lesser salary than when you are in your country. In fact I will never advise my enemy to start a career at Globacom. It's indeed the most horrible place for a young guy to start a career

headline: Poor work environment
pros: You might have time for yourself most times. It is a good place to start career for just 1 to 2 years.
cons: It is a very disorganized company without structure. Promotions were mostly done based on who you know on top. The staff were not trained, bully,intimidated, coerced, threatened, and without opinion. The lower level officers were grossly underpaid and poorly remunerated. Its just a dumping ground because before you realize what was happening you might be outdated, if you don't get out quickly.

headline: Not an ideal place to build an extensive & long career. You're either here to learn (self-learn) or retire for money
pros:
1. Provides opportunity to entry level candidates
2. Little supervision, you can pursue other goals if you have completed your objectives
3. You can earn above the standard rates if you negotiate well or management is scared of you being poached
4. Very relaxed environment. Semi-professional 
5. Won't be a problem finding a new job
cons:
1. No health insurance, no bonuses, no incentives, no allowance, etc. You may be stuck with one base  for a while
2. No training, no support. You're on you own. 
3. Some members of management are absolutely disrespectful. They think they are gods and you are their minions
4. Management will always choose "saving money" over quality and efficiency
5. Most employees have data cap and won't have internet once they run out
6. The HR Deparment is not people friendly

headline: few positives...many negatives.
pros:
i have met fantastic, talented and genuinely intelligent people at this place.
Our woes are not for the lack of skill or ability.
cons:
in the 21st century, business has gone beyond non structured, gut feeling, reactionary and poorly researched decision making.
if staff welfare, career growth and remuneration is not a priority, then true business growth and survival is not the destination.
